org.ambraproject.wombat.freemarker

Class ThemeConfigDirective

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ambraproject.wombat.freemarker.VariableLookupDirective<Object>
      • org.ambraproject.wombat.freemarker.ThemeConfigDirective
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveModel, freemarker.template.TemplateModel

    public class ThemeConfigDirective
extends VariableLookupDirective<Object>
    Reads a theme config value into a FreeMarker variable. The param "map" is the name of the theme config map to read, and the param "value" is the key of the value to read from the map.

    Example invocation: 

       <@themeConfig map="widget" value="widgetCount" ; c>
     You have ${c}
     <#if c == 1>widget<#else>widgets
    This would read the widget.yaml (or widget.json) from the current page's theme, extract the "widgetCount" value from that map, and set that value as c for the interior of the body.

        Description copied from class: VariableLookupDirective
        Return the value to provide as the body or loopvar.

        The env and params arguments are the same as those specified for TemplateDirectiveModel.execute(freemarker.core.Environment, java.util.Map, freemarker.template.TemplateModel[], freemarker.template.TemplateDirectiveBody). Implementing classes may define their own contracts for the content of params.
